LanguageData.MSSulphuricAcid.label: Sulphuric Acid
LanguageData.MSSulphuricAcid.description: Sulphuric acid (alternative spelling sulfuric acid), also known as vitriol, is a mineral acid composed of the elements sulfur, oxygen and hydrogen, with molecular formula H2SO4. It is a colorless, odorless, and syrupy liquid that is soluble in water and is synthesized in reactions that are highly exothermic. Used as a precursor chemical to form other items. (Made from Sulphur).
